author: lpmaho
title: MLabs - Cardano-Tx-Lib for web3
description: The web3.js libraries for Ethereum support transaction creation in the browser, but similar libraries have yet to come to Cardano.

author: michele.nuzzi
title: Offchain Typescript library
description: existing solutions for smart contract integration via browser (or mobile) are often hard to integrate and poorly documented

author: bitmaster.sg
title: BWORKs - Right Dev in Right Work
description: The lack of services that actively offer Cardano developers to right paid jobs, protect their work and grow their abilities.

author: ninhtran
title: Mentor-mentee Bounties & eLearning
description: Cardano development mentors lack the incentives, tools, & network to actively grow the Cardano dev ecosystem with more developers & mentors.

author: javiertc86
title: Distributed storage Infrastructure
description: Maintaining an IPFS infrastructure is time-consuming and costly.

author: samjeff
title: Cardapper - YT Channel For C-Devs
description: No youtube channel to consistently post Cardano Development Tutorials that developers can watch and learn from for free.

author: parau
title: Tech Talent – Bring Devs to Cardano
description: The shortage of devs is something that affects the software industry.Even so how do we attract devs to participate in the Cardano ecosystem?

author: defidiscussions
title: Haskell/Plutus Course in Spanish
description: LatAm Universities don’t offer many paths to learn haskell/plutus. Learning these is vital for understanding blockchain on a technical level

author: plokqa
title: PyCardano - Build dApps in Python
description: Developers without Haskell experience need to spend months in learning Haskell before they can productively build dApps on Cardano.

author: thrift.labs
title: Thrift Mobile - DeFi Connector
description: A cross mobile wallet providing access to DeFi protocols, focused on the African area through Thrift Finance.

author: antoine
title: Cardano L-EARN (for Developers)
description: The Cardano learning curve is very steep. Many want to learn but are severely limited by time, resources, and willpower.

author: wistkey
title: 15 min Hello World Journey
description: Writing simple smart contracts to decide which chain to dev on, one needs hours on Cardano, but just mins on other chains. Put off dApp devs

author: wistkey.lab
title: Cardano Playground - Fun Tutorials
description: Learning blockchain is not an easy process for youngsters, especially secondary school or college students, at least not fun enough.

author: otaviolima
title: ADABet: Betting Site for Everything
description: Use your portfolio's ADAs to monetize through betting with everyday events and subjects, bringing utility, entertainment and profits.

author: iandebeer
title: Petri Nets: a model to define dApps
description: Its difficult to model the flow of concurrent asynchronous processes (Smart Contracts) in the development of dApps

author: quangtran
title: Haskell Course For Beginner
description: There are many people who really want to write smart contracts and build projects on Cardano. But Haskell is a big barrier for beginners

author: jodelchad
title: CHAINS NFT DEVELOPMENT
description:
WERE BUILDING A PLATFORM THAT CONNECTS WIRELESSLY TO HEALTH RECORD
LINKING PEOPLE TO THE FARM
NEW WIRELESS COLD WALLET (INTERNAL WIRELESS)

author: wolfram.blockchain.labs
title: Wolfram Catalyst Impact Dashboard
description: Catalyst requires hours of research for new users to get up to speed, which creates unequal participation between veterans and newcomers.

author: vivek
title: Analytics Data Hub
description: Data relating to the Cardano ecosystem is granular and scattered, making it difficult to access and use for analytics or machine learning.

author: nicoarqueros
title: Milkomeda token bridge explorer
description: Milkomeda is a sidechain so traceability of wrapping and unwrapping is really difficult because block explorers only work on one side.

author: nicoarqueros
title: App store for Milkomeda
description: Currently one of the hard problems in the blockchain space is discovery. Difficulty in finding dApps lowers user engagement and fuels FUD

author: robertc3
title: Free off-chain data feeds pt. 2
description: Developers need access to off-chain data feeds -- these are costly to setup.

author: nad
title: Zero Knowledge API for Cardano
description: Zero-knowledge Proof (zk) is getting a lot of attention in other blockchains. There is no easy way to build zk-apps for Cardano.

author: mmahut
title: Cardano IPFS chronicles 2022
description: IPFS is widely used in the Cardano, mostly in the NFT ecosystem. It is critical to be able to access this data using a gateway service.

author: nara
title: NuNet: Decentralized GPU ML Cloud
description: Artificial Intelligence (Machine Learning) models need GPU processing power. How to provide such decentralized GPU power to grow Cardano.

author: this.tent
title: Poplar Programming Language
description: Plutus Core is elegant. Haskell is powerful, but it's flexibility as a research language adds cognitive load when reading unfamiliar code

author: joseiadicicco
title: Cardano Hackathon in Argentina
description: Plutus is a new Smart Contracts programming language that few programmers have mastered.

author: sirwolcott
title: Catalyst HeartBeat
description: Long form content requires more time and energy to investigate and digest than many members of Project Catalyst can commit to regularly.

author: rhysstoic
title: P2P Smart Contract Interaction
description: P2P smart contracts require parties to agree on decisions made & executed

author: shirogat
title: East African Catalyst developers
description: The developer community in East Africa still needs to be built, incentivized and motivated to build on Cardano.

author: rhysstoic
title: Plutus Pioneers Upgraded
description: The Plutus Pioneer Program is great, but is difficult to follow and lacks depth of exercises and grading

author: konmagat
title: KodeKlash Hackathons
description: Although Cardano has risen up to an established smart contract platform, the free developer cohort are still lagging behind.

author: nvhieu
title: Automated funding catalyst projects
description: The Catalyst support team is funding proposals manually, This mechanism requires a lot of time and effort

author: sbpabon
title: PLUTUS FOR DEVS IN SPANISH
description: In LatinAmerica, too much Cardano general info, but too little in-depth technical knowledge. We need to guide Latindevs to the substance👬🎓

author: theos1
title: Developer Conferences in S Africa
description: We hosting developer and ux design conferences in South Africa. We would like to use our platform to team developers about the ecosystem.

author: cent
title: JSON API service for developers
description: Cardano Blockchain adoption and size increase has resulted in blockchain data search and access require larger and larger servers

author: quangtran
title: Haskell Book Vietnamese Translation
description: Cardano's Smart Contract is built on Haskell. But there is no book or document about Haskell for developers in Vietnam

author: reshm
title: Transaction monitoring as a service
description: DApps having to poll the blockchain to check status of transactions is not time efficient and involves duplicated work.

author: quangtran
title: Haskell Book Japanese Translation
description: Cardano's Smart Contract is built on Haskell. But there is no book or document about Haskell for developers in Japan

author: romanshape
title: Marketplace for artists
description: Art galleries and NFT marketplaces take a huge chunk of the artists artwork, they are greedy.

author: stanimir.ilic
title: NoCode ADA Blockchain as a Service
description: No easy process of setting up local ADA infrastructure for running complex network tests, creating&deploying smart contracts for beginners.

author: lennext
title: Beyond Create Teaming Agreements
description: It is hard & can be costly for funded Catalyst proposals to select a jurisdiction and type of juristic entity. But success demands they do.

author: gufmar
title: Pool Topology and Block Propagation
description: Operators and Designers need reliable, decentralised connections and better data to understand and optimise individual&overall performance.

author: game.changer.wallet
title: GameChanger: Most Wanted Features ❤
description: Devs and users frequently demand features and bugfixes. As a pure community driven Cardano wallet (no VC/token launch) we need some support

author: felixweber
title: Catalyst SwarmLabs
description: There is a lack of coordinated Initiatives which identify and build tools and solutions with a focus on the Catalyst Ecosystem

author: rocky.blockchainart.works
title: NFT Content Delivery as a Service
description: Seamless NFT content delivery can cost a Cardano service provider circa $30,000 annually. This barrier to entry hinders new app development.

author: ashisherc
title: Cardanoscan.io Upgrade
description: Developers require explorer with features to dig deep technically and help their development needs for smart contracts and dApp projects

author: lutvirosyady
title: Loyalty Point for Developers
description: There will be no specific Loyalty Point for developer that based on Blockchain. It's kind of appreciation for every single contribution made

author: randall
title: Done Collectively: Bounty Aggreg8r
description: The Cardano ecosystem is lacking any well-known bounty boards where people can find good work and start earning without waiting for Catalyst
